intro: Collabium papuanum, commonly known as the Papuan collabium, is a flowering plant native to the lowland rainforests of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and somewhat branched. Collabium papuanum is often found growing in shaded, moist environments and is not widely cultivated outside its native range.
